current.head_tagline: FREE shipping in CAN & USA over $50!
current.text_soldout: Sorry, this product is sold out!
current.text_telluscart: Tell us about any special instructions
current.pp_c:
FEEL good, CREATE good, SHARE the goodness

That’s what we’re all about.

Sign up for our newsletter. It's a little
bit of exclusive KOOSHOO goodness
delivered straight to your inbox!
current.pp_d:
Wishing you a great day,
Rachel & Jesse
current.hpt_1: KOOSHOO was founded by Jesse and Rachel, husband and wife yoga teachers proudly based out of North Vancouver, Canada. Together with a small, tight-knit team, they have set out to create a lifestyle company that does good at every level  – from the communities growing the textiles to the beautiful souls wearing the final yoga headbands, hairties and fashion scarves.
current.hpt_2: Kooshoo means feeling good. The word hails from the rare language of Norfuk, a language indigenous to Norfolk Island, a 3x5 mile island in the South Pacific where 2/3 of our team were born and raised. Every time we make a decision we ask ourselves: "does this feel kooshoo?" This has led us to create beautiful shawls, hairties and yoga headbands that you can truly feel good about.
current.mf_a:
KOOSHOO was founded for a simple reason: to help others feel good. That includes everyone from the individuals growing the crops right through to you, the end consumer. We achieve this by operating our business with the core values of honesty, transparency and love.

Our immediate family may be small - the two of us plus Leilani in Product Development and Genevieve in PR - but our extended family is made up of talented individuals around the world.

We are dedicated to finding and working alongside ethical and sustainable companies in the fashion industry. This has led us to work with family businesses in LA that weave, dye, cut, sew
current.mf_aa:
and package our products. It’s their beautiful work that brings these products to life.

Then there are the friends, new and old, with all their support and encouragement that make KOOSHOO what it is. This, of course, includes you. Thank you!

In Hawaiian there is a beautiful word for family called ohana. With ohana it’s understood that family is there to help uplift each other so there is never anyone left behind. This is how we view KOOSHOO - as our Ohana - and for this reason we choose to donate to charities that help uplift. With this family, we can help people everywhere feel good by creating beautiful products in a way that uplifts all.
current.mf_b:
KOOSHOO is the word that embodies what we‘re all about. It means feeling good in Norfuk, a language spoken exclusively by the people of Norfolk Island, a small island in the South Pacific. As it happens. both our co-founder Rachel and our product developer Leilani are Norfolk Islanders.

Rachel and Leiloni have since moved to Canada though Norfolk lsland remains a constant In our hearts (see the family home built by Rachel and Leiloni's father on Norfolk). Back on Norfolk kooshoo is used in many different woys though perhaps the most common is as part of a greeting:

Wut a way you? (Hi, how are you?)
Kooshoo, you? (feeling good, yourself?)
current.mf_bb:
Here at KOOSHOO HQ we have built our business around a simple question: "does this feel kooshoo?" In other words, every time we make a decision we ask ourselves "is this in support of the greater good?" To see how this questioning has influenced our production line decisions, check out the "The KOOSHOO Way of Business" diagram below.

As for using the word kooshoo, next time someone asks how you're doing, try answering with 'kooshoo', and if you‘re not already feeling kooshoo, you will find after saying it enough times you will start to feel its positive effects! If anything like us, you may just find yourself with a new favorite word.
current.mft_a: Kooshoo (feeling good) is sourcing the finest, softest organic cottons in the world. No synthetics, no pesticide-heavy cottons, only the finest natural materials. It's caring for your skin, the families and communities growing crops, and our planet.
current.mft_b: Kooshoo is supporting local jobs. We design and sample in Canada, then weave, dye, cut, sew and distribute in a 20 mile radius of downtown L.A. Best of both worlds: jobs being created in our communities with a small footprint.
current.mft_c: Kooshoo is dyeing in a solar powered dye house, right in downtown L.A. It is also packing products in 100% recycled shipping bags. In other words, kooshoo is being accountable to our earth.
current.mft_d: Kooshoo is working with family businesses that provide jobs and opportunity for their communities. It’s having a human relationship with our partners to encourage transparency, respect and safety. This way everybody wins.
current.mft_e: Kooshoo is believing in artisans and supporting the all-but-disappeared art of hand dyeing textiles in North America. These incredible textile artists bring your 100% unique KOOSHOO products to life through color.
current.mft_f:
Kooshoo is donating product and profit to charity because we believe in business as a vehicle to uplift. For example, we have helped over 1000 people from marginalized communities attend yoga or meditation classes. Thank you for being a part of this positive change.
LEARN MORE
current.sgo_b: WE DONATE PRODUCT AND MONEY TO CHARITIES THAT UPLIFT OUR COMMUNITIES
current.sg_c:
We believe companies are vehicles for good in our communities. 
That's why we choose to give back by donating a percentage of each sale to the not-for-profit organization Karma Teachers.
current.sg_a:
Karma Teachers Yoga & Meditation Centre is a Vancouver based organization whose mission is to provide FREE yoga (and community) to those less fortunate. They do this by offering yoga, meditation and other healing arts with trained teachers in a clean, safe studio space in Vancouver's Downtown Eastside, Canada's poorest postal code.

Providing those in need with a venue to find balance and peace through yoga is an important part for the organization but it is ultimately the sense of belonging that people feel - of being a part of an uplifting community - that makes the organization so special. Below we've answered a few common questions:
Q. So how exactly does my KOOSHOO purchase help Karma Teachers?

A. From every product sold we donate a percentage of profits to Karma Teachers. In our first year of operations this resulted in over $1000 going to Karma Teachers. That’s enough to provide yoga (and community) for up to 1000 people in need.
Q. Who does Karma Teachers help?

A. Karma Teachers is open to anyone and everyone. Yoga is FREE though as an organization that runs off private
current.sg_b:
donations, those able to donate are encouraged to do so. The studio is located in a diverse community called the Downtown Eastside in Vancouver. Officially listed as Canada's poorest neighbourhood, the studio is well positioned to help those in need. Some of the groups that have been particularly involved at the studio are Vancouver's homeless gay youth, children with autism, ADD and ADHD, impoverished women and those suffering with eating disorders, mental health and addictions.
Q. Where does the organization get its funding?

A. Karma Teachers is a community focused organization and, in turn, relies on the greater community for its funding. Private donations from businesses and individuals alike have thus far sustained the organization. They have also run some creative fundraising initiatives, such as the extremely popular biannual Yogathons.
Q. How do I get involved with Karma Teachers?

A. To attend a FREE yoga/meditation class, donate, propose an initiative or ask a question visit Karma Teachers Yoga & Meditation Centre at www.karmateachers.com or in person at 45 West Hastings in Vancouver.
current.slide_lila_2_alt: Celebrity Alicia Silverstone loves KOOSHOO's all natural, organic, plastic-free Lila hair ties
current.mf_c: We believe companies are vehicles for good in our communities. That's why we choose to donate 11% of proceeds from each sale to the not-for-profit organization Karma Teachers.
current.pp_e: We would love you to be
current.pp_f: the first to know about online exclusives,
current.pp_h: Wishing you a great day, Rachel & Jesse
